---
title: Introducing spatial data science
---

These materials introduce 'spatial data science' or might also be considered a course in 'advanced GIS' which is what it was developed to be when it was Geog 315 at Victoria University of Wellington.

I am happy to discuss developing any or all of these materials into short intensive one/two/three day courses to suit the needs of organisations grappling with connecting their geospatial and data analytics workflows.

Content | Hands-on materials
-- | -- 
**1. Introducing R for geospatial** |
[Open science, open source, and doing GIS in code](content/01-open.qmd)<br>[Starting *R*](content/02-starting-r.qmd) | [Software setup](labs/01-lab.html)<br>[Introducing *R* and *RStudio*](labs/02-lab.html)
**2. Making maps** |
[Choropleth map design](content/03-choropleth-maps.qmd)<br> [Bonus material on zoomed-in maps](content/04-zoomed-in-maps.qmd) | [Making maps](labs/03-lab.html)
**3. Wrangling spatial data** |
[The myth of tidy data](content/05-tidy-data.qmd)<br>[Data wrangling](content/06-data-wrangling.qmd)<br>[Handling tables](content/07-table-joins-and-dissolves.qmd)<br>[Spatial data wrangling](content/08-spatial-data-wrangling.qmd) | [Spatial data manipulation](labs/04-lab.html)
**4. Clustering analysis** |
